channel.title: Coupons?
channel.description:
So, I just came back from Shoprite (a grocery store in USA, mainly CT, NJ, NY, etc.) and "bought" over $100 of merchandise (including a $50 Visa card) for 78 cents out of pocket money, and ended up earning ~$70 in checkout coupons that I can use on anything. So basically, I got free food, a $50 Visa card I can spend on anything, and made $70 that I can use on anything next week in the store.
Note: I've probably gotten over $1000 worth of groceries, etc for around $5 out of pocket money and have probably made over $200.
inb4prooforgtfo
I don't need proof. If you don't believe me, don't post and keep to yourself.
Is couponing worth it? Discuss.

item.title: Coupons?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Yes, the 78 cents was basically tax. Let’s say an item was $1.50 and I had a coupon for 75 cents off. My store doubles coupons, so I receive the item for free. In other cases, there’s a “Buy $20 worth of X products and get a $10 checkout coupon off your next shopping trip.” The $20 that needs to be spent is always before coupons are used and are usually based on shelf (non-sale) prices, so if I use a $3 off coupon on a detergent that is $5 sale price, but $8.50 shelf price, $8.50 would count towards the $20 rather than the $2 I actually paid for it. When I reach the $20 mark, I usually end up paying $5, which I pay using a previous $5 off coupon from last week and receive a $10 checkout coupon for next week or anytime before the expiry date. Thus, I pay nothing out of pocket and “earn” $5. There’s also many times where I pay nothing and get $x in checkout coupons making the deal a x-dollar moneymaker. Sounds too good to be true, but it is.

Read full topic

item.title: Coupons?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Newty:

Do tell how you are doing this.

Double coupons (not all stores let you do more than double), buy1get1free coupons (even buythis getthat ones). I’ve did the same thing when I was low on money, except for my it was more like $30 per $100 worth.

Read full topic

item.title: Coupons?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Coupons are a very great way to save money. I’m surprised people don’t do it more often. You can usually double the amount of groceries you can buy with coupons themselves. It sounds like he has enough coupons at his disposal to barely pay anything out of pocket.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @gravenfire23 gravenfire23
item.description:
@gravenfire23 wrote:

Its definitely worth it, i was watching some wife swap show and one of the family’s clipped coupons as a hobby they ended up getting paid 200$ to go shopping it was pretty awesome

item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

Yeah they’re worth it. Every time I go to Acme most of the time I get a $5 off coupon and I have about 7 of them at the moment, so I got $35 for free basically.

item.title: Coupons?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:2, topic:388019”]Do you say “Koo-Pon” or “Qkeww-pon”

And yea, for 78 cents, that’s fucking awesome. Why wouldnt it be worth it?[/quote]
“Koo-Pon”

Well, some people say it’s annoying, but to be honest, the trip today only took about 30 minutes of my time, and only around 10 minutes to check out. (3 separate transactions…) The cashier, bagger, and customer behind me were all amazed when I paid so little.

Read full topic
